New Records: Jos Buttler became England’s leading scorer in men’s T20Is in the process, on the night he won his 100th cap.
Key Match Events: Jos Buttler was reprieved by Kane Williamson after a dropped catch
Glenn Phillips was dropped by Moeen Ali at cover
Sam Curran closed out the win with a superb spell at the death
Pre-Game Insights: Moeen Ali, England's vice-captain, said 'It's simple for us now really. We’ve got to win all of our games. Our mindset is simply telling ourselves that if we win four games, we win the World Cup.'
Eoin Morgan expected the pitch to spin
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's net run rate is healthy enough that they will almost certainly qualify for the semi-finals by beating Ireland by any margin in their final group game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The used pitch was a major factor in England's decision to bat first
England's long batting line-up enables them to go hard throughout
New Zealand's spinners rolled through five overs between them while conceding only two boundaries
Glenn Phillips is in the form of his life, scoring 62 runs
Others: Ben Stokes has struggled since returning to England's T20I set-up
Paul Collingwood, England's assistant coach, has been defending Stokes in the press
England and New Zealand are the only sides to have reached the semi-finals of both of the last two T20 World Cups
